snippet: SHORT--Stephen. June 11, 1945-December 12, 2015. Stephen Short, a former Procter of the Admiralty, who also served in the Merchant Marine, passed away on December 12th. A longtime member of the New York State bar, his legal career encompassed maritime, criminal and personal injury law. In his youth, Mr. Short was also a gifted athlete, excelling as a swimmer, skier, sailor and avid tennis player. He was also deemed an Olympic caliber fencer by Maestro Odon Niederkirchner, of the NYAC. A colorful figure and lifelong champion of the underdog, he will be missed by all who loved him, including his sisters, Leslie Blake and Cheryl Bulbach and his brother, Dr. Wayne Blackmon. As per his wishes, Mr. Short's corneas were donated to the Eye Bank for Sight Restoration. A Memorial will be held in mid-January at the Village Funeral Home. 1/3
